Description: Fragment of lower body of East Greek pottery bowl. Interior glazed with added red band lined in white and a further white line below; outside, part of two wild goats to right, merely the tip of the horn of the left one, the legs and body of the right one, kneeling, preserved; in the field, rosettes; below, black and red bands above part of probable floral band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 13, no. 38 pl. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.887)
